org.gearvrf.io.cursor3d

Class CursorEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.io.cursor3d.CursorEvent

  • public class CursorEvent
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides all the information corresponding to events generated by a Cursor.

    Register a CursorEventListener with the Cursor object to receive CursorEvents generated by that cursor.

    Make sure that the app consumes the CursorEvent data within the lifetime of the callback as these objects are recycled.

      Use this flag to detect if the input Cursor "is over" the GVRSceneObject.

    • Method Detail

      • getObject

        public GVRSceneObject getObject()
        Use this call to retrieve the affected object.
        Returns:
        The affected GVRSceneObject that caused this CursorEvent to be triggered.

      • isOver

        public boolean isOver()
        Use this flag to detect if the input Cursor "is over" the GVRSceneObject. Note that the definition of this value varies based on the CursorType.
        Returns:
        true if the input is over the corresponding GVRSceneObject. The library returns truetrue when the cursor is "over" an object and for the first instance when the cursor is no longer "over" the object, the library delivers an isOver=false event.

      • isColliding

        public boolean isColliding()
        Returns true if the Cursor is colliding with the corresponding GVRSceneObject. Use getCursor() to get a reference to the Cursor and getObject() to get a reference to the GVRSceneObject. Note that in case of a LaserCursor this call will return the same result as isOver().
        Returns:
        true if the cursor is colliding and false if not.

      • getCursorPositionX

        public float getCursorPositionX()
        Get the 'X' position component of the Cursor that generated this event. The values returned by this call persist only for the duration of the CursorEventListener.onEvent(CursorEvent) call. Make sure to make a copy of this value if you wish to use it past its lifetime.
        Returns:
        'X' position component of the Cursor that generated this event.

      • getCursorPositionY

        public float getCursorPositionY()
        Get the 'Y' position component of the Cursor that generated this event. The values returned by this call persist only for the duration of the CursorEventListener.onEvent(CursorEvent) call. Make sure to make a copy of this value if you wish to use it past its lifetime.
        Returns:
        'Y' position component of the Cursor that generated this event.

      • getCursorPositionZ

        public float getCursorPositionZ()
        Get the 'Z' position component of the Cursor that generated this event. The values returned by this call persist only for the duration of the CursorEventListener.onEvent(CursorEvent) call. Make sure to make a copy of this value if you wish to use it past its lifetime.
        Returns:
        'Z' position component of the Cursor that generated this event.

      • getCursorRotationW

        public float getCursorRotationW()
        Get the 'W' rotation component of the Cursor that generated this event. The values returned by this call persist only for the duration of the CursorEventListener.onEvent(CursorEvent) call. Make sure to make a copy of this value if you wish to use it past its lifetime.
        Returns:
        'W' quaternion component of the Cursor that generated this event.

      • getCursorRotationX

        public float getCursorRotationX()
        Get the 'X' rotation component of the Cursor that generated this event. The values returned by this call persist only for the duration of the CursorEventListener.onEvent(CursorEvent) call. Make sure to make a copy of this value if you wish to use it past its lifetime.
        Returns:
        'X' quaternion component of the Cursor that generated this event.

      • getCursorRotationY

        public float getCursorRotationY()
        Get the 'Y' rotation component of the Cursor that generated this event. The values returned by this call persist only for the duration of the CursorEventListener.onEvent(CursorEvent) call. Make sure to make a copy of this value if you wish to use it past its lifetime.
        Returns:
        'Y' quaternion component of the Cursor that generated this event.

      • getCursorRotationZ

        public float getCursorRotationZ()
        Get the 'Z' rotation component of the Cursor that generated this event. The values returned by this call persist only for the duration of the CursorEventListener.onEvent(CursorEvent) call. Make sure to make a copy of this value if you wish to use it past its lifetime.
        Returns:
        'Z' quaternion component of the Cursor that generated this event.

      • getHitX

        public float getHitX()
        Get the X component of the hit point. The values returned by this call persist only for the duration of the CursorEventListener.onEvent(CursorEvent) call. Make sure to make a copy of this value if you wish to use it past its lifetime.
        Returns:
        'X' component of the hit point.

      • getHitY

        public float getHitY()
        Get the 'Y' component of the hit point. The values returned by this call persist only for the duration of the CursorEventListener.onEvent(CursorEvent) call. Make sure to make a copy of this value if you wish to use it past its lifetime.
        Returns:
        'Y' component of the hit point.

      • getHitZ

        public float getHitZ()
        Get the 'Z' component of the hit point. The values returned by this call persist only for the duration of the CursorEventListener.onEvent(CursorEvent) call. Make sure to make a copy of this value if you wish to use it past its lifetime.
        Returns:
        'Z' component of the hit point.

      • getHitPoint

        public float[] getHitPoint()
        Deprecated. Returns a new float array every call which may lead to frequent GC cycles. Use the more efficient call to {getHitX()}, {getHitY()} and {getHitZ()}.
        Returns the hit point of the cursor and the affected GVRSceneObject
        Returns:
        The coordinates where the cursor intersects with the (@link GVRSceneObject}. The values reported are relative to the center of the affected object.

      • getKeyEvent

        public KeyEvent getKeyEvent()
        Get the key event associated with this CursorEvent(if there is one). Note that not all Cursor objects report KeyEvents. Check for a null before processing the KeyEvent.
        Returns:
        the KeyEvent or null if there isn't one.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Returns the active status of the CursorEvent.
        Returns:
        true when the provided input has an active state and false otherwise.

        This usually denotes a button press on a given input event. The actual interaction that causes the active state is defined by the input provided. To know more about the key that led to this active state make use getKeyEvent() call.

      • getCursor

        public Cursor getCursor()
        Returns the Cursor that generated this event.
        Returns:
        the Cursor object.

      • getMotionEvents

        public java.util.List<MotionEvent> getMotionEvents()
        Get the MotionEvents associated with this CursorEvent(if there are any). Note that not all Cursor objects report MotionEvents. Check for a null before processing them.
        Returns:
        the list of MotionEvents associated with the Cursor for the duration of this CursorEvent or null is there are none.

      • getEventGroup

        public EventGroup getEventGroup()
        Returns the EventGroup of the CursorEvent.
        Returns:
        the EventGroup of the CursorEvent.
        See Also:
        CursorManager.setDepthOrderEnabled(boolean)
